subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Oscar De La Hoya, 36, retired from his career in the ring Tuesday, ending a run in which he won 10 world titles in six divisions and became one of boxing’s most popular fighters. He announced his decision before hundreds of fans at an outdoor plaza in Los Angeles across the street from Staples Center, where a statue of him stands.
